summary: This is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and defense attorney Roy Black regarding a discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein matter, specifically relating to the performance of the Non-Prosecution Agreement. It shows internal DOJ coordination about the case.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney being contacted by an Assistant U.S. Attorney to discuss the Jeffrey Epstein matter; indicates he is out of town and asks what the discussion is about.

connections.description: Roy Black is being contacted by prosecutors to discuss the Epstein matter, indicating he represents or is involved with Epstein's legal defense.

events.title: DOJ Discussion About Epstein NPA
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys coordinate internally about contacting defense attorney Roy Black to discuss the performance of Jeffrey Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The email chain shows DOJ prosecutors discussing contacting defense attorney Roy Black about Jeffrey Epstein's case.
The subject of the proposed discussion is specifically 'the performance of the Non-Prosecution Agreement'.
The correspondence dates to July 30, 2008, during the period when Epstein's controversial plea deal was being implemented.
The document reveals internal coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys about how to approach Epstein's defense counsel.
The email shows Roy Black was out of town when initially contacted about the Epstein matter.
